title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), with the
heading: 1. (1) These Rules may be cited as the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland
text_raw:
1. (1) These Rules may be cited as the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland 

(Fees) (Amendment) Rules 2025. 

(2) The Principal Rules, the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland (Fees) 
(Amendment) Rules 2015 (S.I. No. 238 of 2015), the Pharmaceutical Society of 
Ireland (Fees) (Amendment) Rules 2016 (S.I. No. 311 of 2016), the Rules of 
2017, the Rules of 2020 and these Rules may be cited together as the 
Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland (Fees) Rules 2014 to 2025.

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), with the
heading: In these Rules—
text_raw:
2. 

In these Rules— 

“Principal Rules” means the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland (Fees) 
Rules 2014 (S.I. No. 378 of 2014); 

“Rules of 2017” means the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland (Fees) 
(Amendment) Rules 2017 (S.I. No. 99 of 2017); 

“Rules of 2020” means the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland (Fees) 
(Amendment) Rules 2020 (S.I. No. 213 of 2020).

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), with the
heading: 3. Rule 3(1) (as amended by Rule 3(a) of the Rules of 2020) of the Principal
text_raw:
3. Rule 3(1) (as amended by Rule 3(a) of the Rules of 2020) of the Principal 

Rules is amended— 

(a) by substituting for the definition of “Act” the following: 

“‘Act’ means the Pharmacy Act 2007 (No. 20 of 2007), as 
amended from time to time;”, and 

(b) by substituting for the definition of “Registration Rules” the 

following: 

“‘Registration Rules’ means the Pharmaceutical Society of 
Ireland (Registration) Rules 2008 (S.I. No. 494 of 2008), as 
amended from time to time;”.

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), with the
heading: 4. The Schedule (as amended by Rule 4 of the Rules of 2017) to the
text_raw:
4. The Schedule (as amended by Rule 4 of the Rules of 2017) to the 

Principal Rules is amended by substituting for paragraph 38 the following: 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 18th April, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “Fees in respect of applications for recognition of third country 
applications 

[135] 3

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), with the
heading: 38. Fees payable for application under s.
text_raw:
38. Fees payable for application under s. 
16(2)(b) of the Act, by reference to the 
application 
under 
Regulation 19(5) of the Registration Rules: 

prescribed 

stages 

Stage 1 €500.00 

Stage 2 

Initial Assessment: €1,000.00 

Appeal (if required): €300.00 

Stage 3: N/A 

Stage 4: €3,000.00 

Stage 5: N/A”. 

I, JENNIFER CARROLL MACNEILL, Minister for Health, consent to the 
making of the foregoing Rules. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

16 April, 2025. 

JENNIFER CARROLL MACNEILL, 

Minister for Health. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Council of the 
Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland, 

11 April, 2025. 

KATHERINE MORROW, 

President. 

JOANNE KISSANE, 

Registrar. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [135]

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), with the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Rules amend the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland (Fees) Rules 2014 
(S.I. No. 378 of 2014) to change the fees payable in connection with an 
application for recognition of a qualification as a pharmacist obtained in a third 
country, by reference to application stages prescribed under Regulation 19(5) of 
the Registration Rules. 

These Rules may be cited as the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland (Fees) 
(Amendment) Rules 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [135] 5
